newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates remain low amid excess funds.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates remain low amid excess funds.

text.p: Pakistan's money market rates fluctuated widely on Monday, but ended lower on an increased liquidity in the system, dealers said.

"The market opened on a mixed note with initial offers made at 5.0 percent," one dealer said. "Later they rose to 12 percent, and many deals were struck at 10 percent. But towards the end, bids and offers slipped back and stablised around 2.0 and 6.0 percent."
Dealers said the money rates were likely to remain depressed on Tuesday because of the prevailing liquidity.
